Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.weaponry.effects

Class Mark

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.weaponry.effects.Effect
      • it.polimi.ingsw.model.weaponry.effects.OffensiveEffect
        • it.polimi.ingsw.model.weaponry.effects.Mark
  • public class Mark
extends OffensiveEffect
    Marks are Effects inflicted to a Player that causes them to take increased Damage the next time they are damaged by the same source as the Mark.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class it.polimi.ingsw.model.weaponry.effects.OffensiveEffect

        amount, constraints

      • Fields inherited from class it.polimi.ingsw.model.weaponry.effects.Effect

        author, context, type

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Mark​(int amount, java.util.List<Constraint> constraints)
      This is the only constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void apply()
      Sets up a Mark to be applied by elaborating the valid target list and then applies it directly to all Players in that list.
      void grenade​(Player author, Player target)
      This is a light-weight version of apply(), since it is used when a Player is hit by an attack and wants to respond with a tagback Grenade, dealing 1 Mark to their original attacker.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Creates a short description of the effect.

      • Methods inherited from class it.polimi.ingsw.model.weaponry.effects.Effect

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mark

        public Mark​(int amount,
            java.util.List<Constraint> constraints)
        This is the only constructor.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of Marks the Effect applies.
        constraints - the list of requirements each Player needs to meet in order to be affected.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public void apply()
        Sets up a Mark to be applied by elaborating the valid target list and then applies it directly to all Players in that list.
        Specified by:
        apply in class Effect

      • grenade

        public void grenade​(Player author,
                    Player target)
        This is a light-weight version of apply(), since it is used when a Player is hit by an attack and wants to respond with a tagback Grenade, dealing 1 Mark to their original attacker.
        Parameters:
        author - the Player being hit.
        target - the original attacker.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Creates a short description of the effect.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the description.
